DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable relating an assessment of urinary (having to do with urine) creatinine (the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function) and protein.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating an assessment of urinary (having to do with urine) creatinine (the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function) and protein.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with urine or the organs of the body that produce and get rid of urine.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):Any of a group of complex organic macromolecules that contain carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and usually sulfur and are composed of one or more chains of amino acids. Proteins are fundamental components of all living cells and include many substances, such as enzymes, hormones, and antibodies, that are necessary for the proper functioning of an organism.

Concepts.definition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI)

A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the urine protein-creatini
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the urine protein-creatinine ratio (UPCR) less than 1.0

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the urine protein level less than 1000mg

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a urine protein-creatinine ratio greater than 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is urine protein: creatinine (UPC) <1 or <2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have urine sample tested for proteinuria of 0-1+ by the dipstick method, a urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio less than 1, or have a urinalysis (UA) less than 30 mg/dl?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is urine protein: creatinine (UPC) less than 1 or less than 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart?
